alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 9:49PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Cleveland and northeastern Cherokee Counties through 1030 PM EDT... At 949 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Shelby, or near Boiling Springs NC, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Shelby, Kings Mountain, Boiling Springs NC, Blacksburg, Grover, Patterson Springs, Lattimore, Mooresboro, Earl and Kingstown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for the Piedmont of North Carolina.
